body.header: Complete the plan on the right by choosing a suitable counter-argument (A-H) from the list on the left. There are more counter-arguments than arguments, so you will not use them all.
body.section:
Paragraph 1 – Introduction
Paragraph 2 – Argument 1 + Counter-argumentGM crops interfere with natureCounter-Argument
Paragraph 3 – Argument 2 + Counter-argumentGM foods may be bad for our healthCounter-Argument
Paragraph 4 – Argument 3 + Counter-argumentGM crops may cause ecological damage (e.g. kill harmless insects) Counter-Argument
Paragraph 5 – Conclusion

section.p: BGreater profits for the agriculture industry
CTampering with nature is nothing new in agriculture
DGM crops could be grown in difficult environments such as semi-desert
EFarmers of GM crops are less dependent on environmentally harmful insecticides
FGM crops last longer in storage
GImproved nutritional value of GM foods
HImproved flavour and appearance of GM foods

In Unit 6 we saw how a balanced 'for and against' composition can be written by matching arguments and counter-arguments to form paragraphs. A similar outline can be used for a 'one-sided' composition. In this case, however, linking phrases are used to 'refute' each argument with a counter-argument.
